title: Carbon Dating with the Potential to BecomeÂ Controversial
post:
One wonders whether the carbon dating of the manuscript can really be linked to the carbon dating of the Shroud. They are two very different objects.
In the case of the Koran, it is important to remember that oral tradition was involved and the Arabic script evolved from time to time. There are scholars who have adopted a different approach. Michael Cook and Patricia Crone (Hagarism: The Making of the Islamic World, 1977, Cambridge University Press) contend that the book was formed gradually, in response to Jewish and Christian challenges.
What we see here is also seen in the development of Old Testament and New Testament texts.
